intro: Cryptantha nubigena var. celosioides, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
